As experiments begin, the Doctor and Jamie navigate the complexities of Dalek politics and rebellion.
With the "Human Factor" isolated, the Doctor instigates a Dalek civil war, hoping to end their threat.
The Dalek Emperor reveals the extent of its plan, forcing the Doctor into a moral dilemma about his actions.
In a climactic battle, the Doctor's efforts lead to significant Dalek losses, but at a great personal cost, hinting at the Daleks' eventual return.
The Doctor, Jamie, and Victoria land on Telos, discovering an expedition aiming to enter the legendary Cybermen's tomb.
Inside the tomb, they encounter traps and the reawakening of the Cybermen, who have been in hibernation.
The Cybermen plan to convert the expedition members into Cybermen, while the Doctor works to outsmart them.
The Doctor reseals the Cybermen in their tomb, but not before facing significant moral dilemmas and challenges.
Arriving at a Tibetan monastery, the Doctor investigates sightings of the mythical Yeti, which turn out to be more than mere legend.
The Doctor discovers that the Yeti are robotic servants of the Great Intelligence, seeking to conquer Earth.
The Doctor discovers that the Yeti are robotic servants of the Great Intelligence, seeking to conquer Earth.
With the monks' help, the Doctor and his companions defend the monastery against the Yeti's assault.
Strategies to defeat the Great Intelligence are put to the test, with the Doctor facing a powerful unseen enemy.
The battle against the Great Intelligence intensifies, revealing its plan to use the monastery as a bridgehead for invasion.
The Doctor thwarts the Great Intelligence's plans, saving the monastery and Earth from invasion, at least temporarily.
In a future Earth ice age, the Doctor discovers a buried Martian warrior, an Ice Warrior, being revived from the ice.
The Ice Warrior, Varga, plans to conquer Earth, starting by freeing his fellow warriors trapped in the glacier.
The Doctor and the base scientists race to stop the Ice Warriors from thawing out their spaceship.
Tensions rise as the Ice Warriors seize control of the base, with the Doctor devising a counterattack.
With Earth's future in balance, a plan is executed to stop the Ice Warriors and their ship from becoming a threat.
The Doctor manages to defeat the Ice Warriors, ensuring the safety of the base and preventing the Martian invasion.
The Doctor is mistaken for Salamander, a dictator with a striking resemblance to him, leading to a dangerous game of deception.
Investigating Salamander's operations, the Doctor uncovers a plot involving natural disasters used for political gain.
The Doctor infiltrates Salamander's inner circle, discovering sinister experiments and a plan to dominate the world.
As tensions rise, the Doctor and his companions work with rebels to expose Salamander's tyranny.
The battle against Salamander escalates, with the fate of entire nations at stake.
In a dramatic confrontation, the Doctor confronts Salamander, resulting in a dangerous showdown with unexpected consequences.
Returning to London, the Doctor finds the city deserted, with a mysterious web-like substance everywhere and the return of the Yeti.
Trapped in the London Underground, the Doctor and his companions ally with soldiers fighting the Yeti.
The Great Intelligence controls the Yeti, seeking revenge on the Doctor and aiming to conquer the Earth.
The Doctor works to stop the spread of the web and the Yeti, uncovering the Intelligence's human agent.
With London at risk, the Doctor devises a plan to use the London Underground to defeat the Yeti and their master.
A final battle against the Great Intelligence ensues, with the Doctor risking everything to save Earth from being overrun.
The TARDIS lands on the North Sea coast, where the Doctor and his companions investigate a mysterious gas pipeline.
Discovering a sentient seaweed controlling humans and threatening the gas flow, the situation becomes dire.
The seaweed's influence grows, with the Doctor realizing its potential to overrun the Earth.
Attempts to contain the spread fail, leading the Doctor to seek a new solution to combat the threat.
With the base under siege, the Doctor and his companions work frantically to develop a weapon against the seaweed.
In a desperate move, Victoria's screams prove vital in combating the seaweed, leading to a bittersweet victory.
The Doctor and Jamie encounter a space station, the Wheel, which is under threat from the Cybermen planning to invade Earth.
Cybermats, small cybernetic creatures, infiltrate the station, sabotaging its defenses against the impending Cybermen invasion.
The Doctor works with the station's crew to uncover the full extent of the Cybermen's plan and fortify their defenses.
As the Cybermen's attack begins, the Doctor and Jamie race to repair the station's laser cannon in time to defend it.
The station battles the Cybermen in space, while the Doctor devises a plan to outwit their cybernetic logic.
In a daring confrontation, the Doctor ensures the Wheel's safety and thwarts the Cybermen's Earth invasion plans.
Landing on the peaceful planet Dulkis, the Doctor and his companions face the Dominators and their robot servants, the Quarks.
The Dominators plan to turn Dulkis into radioactive fuel for their fleet, exploiting its pacifist inhabitants.
Resistance forms among the Dulcians as the Doctor uncovers the full scale of the Dominators' devastation plan.
The Doctor and Jamie sabotage the Dominators' drilling operations, aiming to prevent the planet's destruction.
With the help of the Dulcians, the Doctor mounts a final stand against the Dominators, saving Dulkis from annihilation.
To escape a volcanic eruption, the TARDIS lands in the Land of Fiction, where reality is dictated by imagination.
Trapped in a world of myth and legend, the Doctor and his companions encounter fictional characters come to life.
The Doctor meets the Master of the Land, who seeks the Doctor's creativity to escape his own fictional existence.
Battling through challenges, the Doctor works to keep his companions from being permanently absorbed into the fictional world.
The Doctor confronts the Master of the Land, using his wits to restore reality and free them from the realm of fiction.
Investigating International Electromatics, the Doctor uncovers a sinister plot involving Cybermen planning to invade Earth.
With UNIT's help, led by Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart, the Doctor begins to counter the Cybermen's infiltration tactics.
The Cybermen emerge from the sewers of London, as the Doctor and UNIT prepare to defend the city.
Strategies and alliances are tested as the Doctor works to prevent the Cybermen from taking over key positions.
The battle against the Cybermen intensifies, with London's fate hanging in the balance.
In a final effort, the Doctor and UNIT launch a daring counterattack to stop the Cybermen's invasion force.
With the help of UNIT, the Doctor hatches a plan to disable the Cybermen's control signal, preventing their army from fully activating.
In a final effort, the Doctor and UNIT launch an attack on the Cybermen's spaceship, ensuring the safety of Earth from the invasion.
The Doctor, Jamie, and Zoe land on a planet where the Gonds are subjugated by the mysterious Krotons.
They discover that the Krotons are crystalline beings, using the mental energy of the Gonds' best students to sustain themselves.
The Doctor devises a plan to challenge the Krotons and free the Gonds from their influence.
In a daring confrontation, the Doctor and his companions manage to destroy the Krotons and liberate the Gonds.
Arriving at a T-Mat relay station on the Moon, the Doctor faces the Ice Warriors, who plan to invade Earth using the T-Mat network.
The Ice Warriors introduce deadly seed pods into the T-Mat system, threatening Earth with a fast-growing, oxygen-absorbing fungus.
The Doctor and Jamie work to sabotage the Ice Warriors' control of T-Mat while Zoe helps Earth's authorities combat the fungal growth.
With Earth's atmosphere at risk, the Doctor develops a countermeasure to neutralize the fungus.
The battle to regain control of the T-Mat system leads to a direct confrontation with the Ice Warriors on the Moon.
The Doctor successfully thwarts the Ice Warriors' invasion plans, ensuring the safety of the T-Mat network and Earth.
The Doctor, Jamie, and Zoe find themselves embroiled in a conflict between space pirates and the Space Corps over stolen argonite.
As they navigate the dangers of space and piracy, the trio works to uncover the pirates' base of operations.
The Doctor strategizes to outwit the pirates and recover the stolen argonite for the Space Corps.
Trapped on a pirate ship, the Doctor and his companions plot their escape and the recovery of the argonite.
With the situation escalating, alliances are tested as they close in on the pirate leader.
In a final showdown, the Doctor's ingenuity ensures the defeat of the pirates and the return of peace to the space lanes.
The TARDIS lands in what appears to be World War I, but the Doctor soon discovers they are on a planet where wars from Earth's history are being recreated.
Captured by soldiers from different eras, the Doctor realizes they are pawns in the War Lords' plan to create an invincible army.
With the help of resistance fighters, the Doctor seeks to undermine the War Lords and their alien technology.
The scale of the War Lords' operation is revealed, with the Doctor formulating a risky plan to stop them.
Allies from various time zones unite, leading a rebellion against the War Lords with the Doctor's guidance.
The Doctor confronts the War Lord, leading to a climactic battle and the Doctor's decision to call for the Time Lords' intervention.
With the Time Lords' arrival, the Doctor faces trial for his interference in the affairs of other worlds, leading to his forced regeneration and exile to Earth.
As the rebellion gains momentum, the Doctor discovers the alien technology controlling the war games and seeks to dismantle it.
The War Chief, recognizing the Doctor, reveals a Time Lord connection, complicating the Doctor's efforts to stop the games.
Faced with the War Lords' overwhelming power, the Doctor makes the critical decision to call for Time Lord intervention.
The newly regenerated Doctor arrives on Earth and is found by UNIT, as meteorites herald the arrival of the Autons.
Investigating the meteorites, the Doctor and Liz Shaw discover they contain Nestene Consciousness, controlling plastic.
The Autons, animated by the Nestene, begin their attack, posing a unique challenge to UNIT and the Doctor.
The Doctor devises a plan to stop the Nestene Consciousness, using his knowledge of extraterrestrial threats to save Earth.
Investigating power outages at a nuclear research facility, the Doctor discovers an ancient race, the Silurians.
The Silurians, prehistoric Earth inhabitants, plan to reclaim the planet from humanity.
As a deadly virus spreads from the Silurians, the Doctor works on a cure while trying to broker peace.
Tensions escalate between the Silurians and humans, with the Doctor caught in the middle advocating for coexistence.
The Doctor races to distribute the cure to the virus while convincing the Silurians and humans to negotiate.
Despite the Doctor's efforts, mistrust leads to confrontation, and the Doctor faces a difficult decision regarding the Silurians' fate.
In a bittersweet conclusion, the Doctor reflects on the missed opportunity for peace between humans and Silurians.
The Doctor investigates the mystery of a space capsule's lost astronauts and encounters an alien ambassadorial mission gone awry.
Communication with the kidnapped astronauts reveals a sinister plot and the presence of alien ambassadors on Earth.
The Doctor uncovers a conspiracy involving the ambassadors, who possess deadly radiation powers.
As the situation escalates, the Doctor works to prevent a potential war between Earth and the ambassadors' home planet.
The Doctor devises a risky plan to expose the humans conspiring with the aliens, aiming to use the ambassadors for their own ends.
With global tensions rising, the Doctor negotiates for peace and the safe return of the ambassadors to their world.
In a tense finale, the Doctor's efforts lead to the resolution of the crisis, averting an interplanetary war.
Experimenting with a new energy source, the Doctor is transported to a parallel Earth where Britain is a fascist dictatorship.
In this alternate world, the Doctor witnesses the catastrophic consequences of the energy project gone wrong.
As the parallel Earth faces destruction, the Doctor searches for a way back to his own world to prevent the same disaster.
Back on his Earth, the Doctor races against time to convince the project's leaders of the impending doom.
The situation becomes critical as the project spirals out of control, threatening to unleash a global catastrophe.
With the drilling project nearing its critical point, the Doctor and UNIT work frantically to halt it.
In a desperate bid to stop the disaster, the Doctor's knowledge from the parallel world proves crucial, saving Earth from a similar fate.
The Doctor encounters the Master, a renegade Time Lord, who has come to Earth with deadly Autons and Nestene Consciousness.
The Master uses his hypnotic powers to control humans and Autons, creating chaos and threatening global invasion.
The Doctor discovers the Master's plan to unleash the Nestene's living plastic, putting every human at risk.
In a climactic battle, the Doctor and UNIT face the Auton invasion, working to thwart the Master's scheme and repel the Nestene.
The Doctor investigates a revolutionary machine that extracts evil from criminals' minds, uncovering a sinister plot.
The machine, controlled by the Master, creates deadly havoc, amplifying fear and aggression at a peace conference.
As global tensions rise, the Doctor works to neutralize the machine's influence and uncover the Master's ultimate goal.
The Doctor and the Master engage in a mental battle, with the fate of the peace conference and the world at stake.
With the machine's true nature revealed, the Doctor devises a plan to safely dismantle it and capture the Master.
A showdown at the prison tests the Doctor's resolve, leading to the Master's temporary defeat but not his capture.
A seemingly benevolent alien race, the Axons, arrives on Earth, offering a miraculous energy source.
The Doctor suspects the Axons' gift hides a nefarious purpose, investigating their true intentions.
The Axons reveal their plan to drain Earth's resources, transforming into monstrous forms to battle the Doctor and UNIT.
With the Master's reluctant assistance, the Doctor foils the Axon plot, saving Earth but allowing the Master to escape.
The Time Lords send the Doctor and Jo to a distant planet where colonists and a mining corporation vie for control.
Investigating the conflict, the Doctor uncovers an ancient alien civilization's secrets that could destroy the planet.
The Master arrives, seeking to exploit the planet's power, forcing the Doctor to intervene.
The Doctor strives to mediate between the colonists and miners while thwarting the Master's plan.
As the alien power awakens, the Doctor must resolve the conflict and prevent the Master from seizing control.
In a final confrontation, the Doctor ensures the planet's safety, leading to the Master's defeat but not his capture.
In the English village of Devil's End, the Doctor investigates an ancient demon's awakening orchestrated by the Master.
The awakened Daemon, Azal, considers transferring his power, with the Master aiming to control it.
As the village is besieged by supernatural forces, the Doctor uncovers the truth behind the Daemons' mythology.
The Doctor and UNIT rally the villagers to fight the Master's influence and the Daemon's might.
With cleverness and courage, the Doctor confronts Azal, defeating the Daemon and thwarting the Master's plan, leading to his capture.
The Doctor and Jo encounter guerillas from the future who are fighting against a Dalek-occupied Earth.
Investigating time disturbances, the Doctor realizes the Daleks plan to change history to ensure their domination.
In the 22nd century, the Doctor aims to foil the Daleks' plot, battling both Daleks and their Ogron minions.
With a carefully crafted counterattack, the Doctor and the guerillas work to restore the timeline and defeat the Daleks.
The Doctor and Jo visit the planet Peladon, where they become embroiled in political intrigue amid a Galactic Federation conference.
As they navigate the palace's dangers, they uncover a plot to sabotage Peladon's entry into the Federation.
The Doctor works to reveal the true saboteur, facing off against alien delegates and the legendary Aggedor.
In a bid for peace, the Doctor exposes the conspiracy, securing Peladon's place in the Federation.
Investigating mysterious ship disappearances, the Doctor discovers the Sea Devils, an aquatic cousin of the Silurians.
The Master, imprisoned nearby, is attempting to ally with the Sea Devils to conquer the surface world.
The Doctor attempts a peaceful negotiation with the Sea Devils, which is sabotaged by the Master's machinations.
As conflict looms, the Doctor and Jo work to prevent a war between humanity and the Sea Devils.
The Master's plans escalate, leading to a showdown on the Sea Devils' undersea base.
The Doctor takes drastic action to stop the Master and the Sea Devils, aiming to preserve peace between species.
Sent to the planet Solos, the Doctor and Jo are caught in a struggle between the imperial Overlords and the mutating Solonians.
Investigating the mutations, the Doctor discovers they are part of the planet's natural evolution, complicated by the Overlords' rule.
The struggle for independence intensifies, with the Doctor advocating for the Solonians' right to evolve and govern themselves.
Facing opposition from the Overlords and internal betrayal, the Doctor works to protect the Solonians' future.
With Jo's help, the Doctor races against time to unlock the secret of the mutations and Solos's liberation.
In a final stand, the Doctor and the Solonians confront the Overlords, ensuring Solos's path to self-determination.
The Doctor investigates a scientific experiment that accidentally taps into the time vortex, attracting the attention of an ancient Atlantean figure, Kronos.
The Master, seeking to control Kronos for his own purposes, manipulates the experiment, endangering reality itself.
The Doctor and Jo Grant travel through various periods, attempting to thwart the Master's plans and prevent Kronos's catastrophic release.
In ancient Atlantis, the Doctor confronts the Master and the consequences of unleashing a being of pure time.
With Atlantis facing destruction, the Doctor must find a way to rebind Kronos and repair the damage to the time vortex.
In a dramatic resolution, the Doctor and the Master's battle reaches its climax, with the fate of time itself in balance.
The 10th anniversary special sees the Time Lords breaking their own laws, allowing the First, Second, and Third Doctors to unite against a common threat.
Together, they face Omega, a Time Lord legend who has been exiled to a universe of anti-matter and seeks revenge.
With the fabric of reality at risk, the three Doctors navigate Omega's domain, confronting bizarre challenges.
In a climactic effort, they devise a plan to neutralize Omega's threat and restore balance to the universe, with the Third Doctor's exile on Earth being lifted as gratitude by the Time Lords.
Investigating a space carnival, the Doctor and Jo Grant find themselves trapped inside the Miniscope, a device that contains miniaturized environments and creatures.
Inside, they encounter various alien species and historical figures, all while trying to find a way out.
The Doctor uncovers the truth behind the Miniscope's existence and its creator's intentions.
They work to free the beings trapped within and ensure the Miniscope is never used again.
The TARDIS lands in the midst of a tense stand-off between Earth and the Draconian Empire, with the Doctor and Jo caught in the crossfire.
The Master appears, stirring the pot of conflict with his machinations, aiming to incite a full-scale war.
The Doctor attempts to mediate peace talks, uncovering a deeper conspiracy involving the Ogrons.
As the plot thickens, the Doctor faces off against both the Draconians' suspicions and the Master's schemes.
The brink of war looms closer, with the Doctor racing to expose the true enemy and avert disaster.
In a daring bid for peace, the Doctor and Jo navigate political intrigue and espionage to prevent galactic war.
Following the events of "Frontier in Space," the Doctor and Jo land on Spiridon, where they encounter a Dalek operation threatening the galaxy.
They discover the Daleks' plan to exploit Spiridon's invisible creatures and perfect their own invisibility.
Joining forces with a group of Thals, the Doctor works to sabotage the Dalek base and their experiments.
The battle against the Daleks intensifies, revealing the presence of a massive Dalek army in suspended animation.
With the Dalek threat greater than ever, the Doctor and his allies plot to destroy the Dalek army and their base.
A daring assault on the Dalek base leads to a decisive victory, but not without cost, as the Doctor narrowly escapes.
Investigating mysterious deaths in a Welsh mining village, the Doctor and UNIT uncover a corporation's hazardous waste causing mutations.
The emergence of giant maggots poses a new threat, linked to the waste, as the Doctor seeks a solution.
Jo Grant becomes deeply involved with a local environmental group, complicating the investigation.
The Doctor discovers the corporation's use of a dangerous chemical, leading to a confrontation.
With the situation escalating, the Doctor races to find a cure for the mutations and stop the corporation.
In an emotional finale, the Doctor saves the village, and Jo Grant decides to leave with her new fianc–, marking a significant departure.
Investigating medieval disappearances, the Doctor discovers a Sontaran warrior, Linx, using a time scoop to kidnap scientists from the future.
Linx seeks to repair his spaceship, indifferent to the temporal chaos he causes, as the Doctor teams up with the bold journalist Sarah Jane Smith.
The Doctor and Sarah work to free the kidnapped scientists and thwart Linx's plans, navigating medieval politics and battles.
In a confrontation at Linx's castle, the Doctor manages to send the Sontaran back to his own time, restoring the timeline.
Returning to London, the Doctor and Sarah find the city evacuated due to mysterious dinosaur appearances.
Uncovering a conspiracy to revert Earth to a pre-technological age, the Doctor faces both dinosaurs and human fanatics.
As the plot unfolds, the Doctor discovers time travel technology is being misused to bring the dinosaurs into the present.
The Doctor and UNIT work to stop the time experiments, facing ethical dilemmas about the conspirators' idealistic motives.
With London under threat, the Doctor devises a plan to neutralize the dinosaurs and expose the conspiracy's leaders.
The Doctor's efforts culminate in thwarting the plan, ensuring the safety of the present and the future of humanity.
The TARDIS loses power on a planet where the Daleks are seeking a cure for a plague affecting their kind.
With both the Daleks and the TARDIS incapacitated by an energy-draining force, the Doctor and Sarah ally with the Exxilons, the planet's natives.
The Doctor discovers an ancient Exxilon city is the source of the energy drain, a living entity that sees all as a threat.
Navigating the city's traps, the Doctor aims to restore power to the TARDIS and stop the Daleks' genocidal plan.
Returning to Peladon, the Doctor finds the planet again in turmoil, with miners rebelling against dangerous conditions and alien interference suspected.
Investigating, the Doctor and Sarah encounter old allies and new challenges, including the Ice Warriors' return.
The Ice Warriors, claiming to be allies, are discovered to be exploiting Peladon's political strife for their own ends.
The Doctor works to unite Peladon's factions, exposing the Ice Warriors and restoring peace to the planet.
Commander Azaxyr and his Ice Warriors are revealed as traitors, in league with Galaxy 5. The Doctor intends to turn Aggedor against Azaxyr, but it may already be too late.
The Doctor and the miners take the upper hand in the fight to reclaim Peladon from the Ice Warriors. But Eckersley is unwilling to give up and takes Queen Thalira hostage.
The Doctor investigates a meditation center where a powerful crystal is linked to psychic experiments and alien spiders.
The spiders of Metebelis 3 seek the crystal, using human hosts to reclaim it, revealing the Doctor's past actions have consequences.
On Metebelis 3, the Doctor faces the Great One, a giant spider seeking to control the universe through the crystal's power.
With Earth and Metebelis 3 at stake, the Doctor must confront his fears and make a sacrifice to stop the Great One's plan.
The Doctor's actions lead to his exposure to lethal radiation, prompting a return to UNIT HQ for his final moments.
In a poignant farewell, the Doctor regenerates into his Fourth incarnation, watched over by Sarah Jane and the Brigadier.
The newly regenerated Fourth Doctor faces his first challenge against a giant robot being used by a radical scientific group to steal nuclear codes.
The Doctor, with the help of Sarah Jane Smith and the newly introduced Harry Sullivan, works to stop the robot, which grows uncontrollably due to experimental metal.
The conflict escalates as the robot, confused and enraged, poses a threat to London, with the Doctor sympathizing with its plight.
In a poignant conclusion, the Doctor uses a virus to corrode the robot, saving humanity but at the cost of the robot's life, highlighting themes of science and ethics.
The TARDIS lands on a space station, the Ark, where the last humans are in cryogenic sleep, awaiting reawakening on a new Earth.
They discover the station has been overrun by the Wirrn, insect creatures that lay their eggs in humans, intending to use the Ark to invade Earth.
The Doctor devises a plan to repel the Wirrn and protect the future of the human race, involving exposing the station's solar panels.
In a desperate bid, the Doctor and his companions fight off the Wirrn and restart the Ark, ensuring humanity's survival and journey to Earth.
On a future Earth now reclaimed by nature, the Doctor investigates a series of mysterious disappearances, uncovering a Sontaran plot.
The Sontaran, Styre, is conducting brutal experiments on humans for research on Earth's conquest, with the Doctor challenging him.
The Time Lords send the Doctor to Skaro at the time of the Daleks' creation, tasking him with altering their development or destroying them.
The Doctor, Sarah Jane, and Harry find themselves in the midst of a brutal war between the Kaleds and Thals.
They encounter Davros, the Kaled scientist whose experiments will lead to the Daleks, grappling with the moral implications of genocide.
The Doctor infiltrates the Dalek creation facility, debating whether to prevent their existence and alter countless lives.
With the Daleks' first deployment, the Doctor works to limit their future power, indirectly causing their pursuit of supremacy.
The Doctor leaves Skaro, having implanted the seeds of the Daleks' eventual defeat, but questioning the cost of his decisions.
Returning to the Ark, the Doctor finds it targeted by Cybermen seeking revenge against Voga, the planet of gold, deadly to them.
Amidst betrayal and a deadly cyber-virus, the Doctor navigates the conflict between the Cybermen and the Vogans.
The Doctor thwarts the Cybermen's plans, using Vogan gold to defeat them, saving the Ark and its crew once again.
In the aftermath, the Doctor reflects on the nature of revenge and the cycle of conflict, as the TARDIS team departs for new adventures.
In Scotland, the Doctor investigates mysterious attacks linked to the Loch Ness Monster, uncovering the shape-shifting Zygons' plot for Earth.
The Zygons, using their bio-engineered creature, the Skarasen, aim to conquer Earth, with the Doctor working to expose their disguises.
The Doctor and his allies uncover the Zygon spaceship hidden beneath the loch, engaging in a battle to thwart their plans.
With clever tactics, the Doctor disrupts the Zygons' control over the Skarasen and foils their invasion, ensuring the safety of Earth.
Responding to a distress call from the edge of the universe, the Doctor lands on Zeta Minor, where a scientific expedition has encountered a mysterious force.
The force on Zeta Minor, bridging our universe and an anti-matter universe, poses a grave danger, consuming those who seek the planet's resources.
The Doctor must navigate the delicate balance between matter and anti-matter to prevent the force from consuming all.
In a tense resolution, the Doctor manages to return the stolen anti-matter, restoring balance and saving the expedition's survivors.
In 1911 England, the Doctor discovers a doorway to Mars in an Egyptian tomb, awakening Sutekh, an ancient and malevolent god imprisoned by his own race.
Sutekh's servants, the Osirans, pose deadly challenges as the Doctor and Sarah Jane seek to prevent Sutekh's release.
The Doctor travels to Mars to confront Sutekh's power directly, attempting to delay his liberation and the destruction of Earth.
Using ingenuity and ancient Osiran technology, the Doctor traps Sutekh in a time corridor, thwarting his plans and saving Earth.
In a seemingly idyllic English village, the Doctor uncovers an android duplicate plot orchestrated by the Kraals, aiming to invade Earth.
With android replicas of key figures, the Kraals plan to replace humanity; the Doctor seeks to expose and stop them.
Discovering the Kraals' weakness, the Doctor sabotages their control systems, freeing the captives intended for duplication.
The Doctor and Sarah Jane prevent the android invasion, ensuring the Kraals' defeat and Earth's safety.
On the planet Karn, the Doctor encounters the mad scientist Solon, who seeks to revive the Time Lord criminal Morbius.
Solon's gruesome experiments and Morbius's potential resurrection pose a dire threat, with the Doctor battling to stop them.
As Morbius partially revives, the Doctor confronts both him and Solon, seeking to end their threat permanently.
In a dramatic showdown, the Doctor uses his wits to defeat Morbius, preventing his return and saving the universe from his tyranny.
Investigating a rapidly growing alien pod in Antarctica, the Doctor learns of its connection to the Krynoid, a plant species that consumes animal life.
As the Krynoid threatens to overrun Earth, transforming humans into plant monsters, the Doctor races to find a solution.
With global stakes, the Doctor and Sarah Jane confront Harrison Chase, a botanist aiding the Krynoid's spread for his own gain.
In a desperate move, the Doctor stops the Krynoid and Chase, using a combination of science and bravery to save humanity.
The Krynoid demands that the Doctor be surrendered to it. But the Time Lord escapes and seeks help. Sarah and Scorby, still trapped on the estate, battle the living plants.
The Doctor, Sarah and Scorby are hunted down by the mad Harrison Chase. Outside the Krynoid prepares to germinate, sending its deadly seed pods out across the world.
In Renaissance Italy, the Doctor and Sarah Jane land in San Martino, entangled in court intrigue and the sinister Cult of Demnos.
The Helix Energy, a malevolent force from the Mandragora constellation, seeks to halt human progress, manipulating events.
As the cult prepares for a deadly sacrifice under the Helix's influence, the Doctor works to thwart their dark plans.
With clever maneuvering, the Doctor disrupts the Helix's energy, saving Renaissance Earth from a backward slide into darkness.
After a quarry explosion, Sarah Jane finds a fossilized hand, unwittingly releasing Eldrad, a silicon-based life form seeking to rebuild itself.
Eldrad manipulates the Doctor and Sarah to help him return to his home planet, Kastria, to reclaim his throne.
On Kastria, they discover a barren world and the true extent of Eldrad's ambition and deception.
The Doctor prevents Eldrad's plans for conquest, but this adventure concludes with a heartfelt farewell as Sarah decides to leave the TARDIS.
Returning to Gallifrey, the Doctor is embroiled in a political conspiracy, framed for the assassination of the President of the Time Lords.
Delving into the Matrix, a virtual reality battle against an unknown assailant reveals the plot's depth and true enemy.
The Doctor uncovers a scheme to control Gallifrey, facing off against the Master, now desperate and decayed, seeking a new regeneration cycle.
In a climactic confrontation, the Doctor foils the Master's plan, saving Gallifrey at a personal cost, with the Master escaping once again.
The Doctor lands on a planet where he discovers a primitive tribe worshiping him as an evil god, a result of a past mistake.
Encountering the Sevateem and the Tesh, two factions of the same race, he unravels the truth behind their division and the "evil" haunting them.
With the introduction of Leela, a fierce warrior of the Sevateem, the Doctor confronts the computer Xoanon, driven mad by his previous actions.
Repairing Xoanon and reconciling the tribes, the Doctor takes Leela as a new companion, acknowledging his responsibility to rectify his past errors.
Aboard a vast mining vessel, the Doctor and Leela investigate a series of murders among the crew, with robots as prime suspects.
As paranoia mounts, they uncover a plot to incite a robot rebellion, challenging Asimov's Laws of Robotics.
The Doctor deduces the identity of the saboteur, using logic and psychology against the robot revolution's instigator.
Preventing the uprising, the Doctor safeguards the crew and robots, highlighting themes of consciousness and control.
In Victorian London, the Doctor and Leela face the sinister Li H'sen Chang and his master, Weng-Chiang, in a tale of time travel and ancient evil.
Investigating disappearances linked to the Chinese theatre, they encounter a world of opium dens, Chinese tongs, and dark magic.
The Doctor unravels Weng-Chiang's true identity as a future war criminal using 51st-century technology to sustain his life.
Confronting Weng-Chiang in his lair, the Doctor battles to prevent his plans for domination, ending the reign of terror with ingenuity and bravery.
Weng-Chiang/Magnus Greel has recovered his lost time cabinet and the Doctor hurries to track him down before he uses it and destroys the whole of London.
The Doctor tracks Greel to his secret hideaway at the House of the Dragon. There the Doctor reveals the Weng-Chiang's real identity and confronts him for the last time.
The Doctor and Leela land on Fang Rock, an isolated lighthouse, where a mysterious entity begins picking off the keepers and stranded visitors.
They discover a Rutan, a member of the race at war with the Sontarans, has crash-landed, seeking to conquer Earth.
As the Rutan threatens all on Fang Rock, the Doctor devises a plan to stop it, battling both the alien and the elements.
In a dramatic showdown, the Doctor uses the lighthouse itself as a weapon, ensuring the Rutan's defeat and the safety of Earth.
A space virus infects the Doctor, manifesting as a battle for his mind within the TARDIS, introducing the concept of the Doctor's mental landscape.
With the virus threatening to take over, the Doctor and Leela seek help, leading to the creation of the Doctor's clone and a miniature journey inside his brain.
They confront the virus's physical form, fighting to save the Doctor's identity and prevent the virus from spreading across the universe.
The Doctor's ingenuity prevails, with the introduction of K9, the robotic dog, who becomes a beloved companion.
Investigating a rural English village, the Doctor discovers an ancient skull that harnesses lethal, evolutionary power, awakening the Fendahl.
The Fendahl, a creature feared by Time Lords, threatens to consume all life, using human hosts and psychic energy.
Delving into the myth and science behind the Fendahl, the Doctor races to uncover its weaknesses.
With time running out, the Doctor finds a way to return the Fendahl to its time loop, averting global catastrophe.
On Pluto, with its artificial suns, the Doctor and Leela join a rebellion against the Company, oppressive rulers exploiting the human colonists.
They inspire the downtrodden workers to challenge the Company's taxation and control, uncovering the true nature of their alien overlords.
As the rebellion gains momentum, the Doctor dismantles the Company's infrastructure, targeting their economic and power bases.
The Doctor's strategic victories spark a revolution, freeing Pluto's colonies from the Company's tyranny and promising a new future.
In a quest for the lost race of the Minyans, the Doctor encounters a society living aboard a spaceship, repeating ancient Greek myths.
The Minyans, influenced by Time Lord society, seek their race bank to begin anew, navigating through challenges inspired by their mythological past.
The Doctor aids their quest, facing technological and moral dilemmas reminiscent of the Time Lords' own history.
In an epic conclusion, the Doctor ensures the Minyans can start afresh on a new world, reflecting on the cyclical nature of myth and civilization.
The Doctor returns to Gallifrey, claiming the presidency, and behaving erratically, initiating a controversial plan involving the TARDIS.
His actions, seemingly betraying Time Lord society, hide a deeper strategy against an impending invasion by the Vardans.
With Gallifrey vulnerable, the Doctor's true intentions unravel, aiming to outsmart the Vardans and protect his home.
The Doctor's gambit against the Vardans opens another front as the Sontarans enter the fray, exploiting the chaos for their own invasion.
As the Sontaran threat looms, the Doctor rallies Gallifrey's defenses, employing cunning and Time Lord technology.
In a final battle within the TARDIS and Gallifrey, the Doctor secures victory.
The Doctor and Romana begin their quest for the Key to Time on the medieval planet Ribos, encountering con men and a tyrannical ruler in their search for the first segment.
Amidst icy catacombs and deceit, they navigate the complex politics of Ribos to secure the segment, disguised as a valuable mineral.
The Doctor and Romana's search for the first segment of the Key to Time is hampered when the Graff Vynda-K takes them prisoner.
Pursued into the catacombs by the Graff and attacked by the ferocious Shrivenzale, the Doctor and Romana struggle to stay alive and find the first segment of the Key to Time.
On the hollow planet Zanak, the Doctor and Romana face the Pirate Captain, who plunders entire planets to sustain his world.
They discover the second segment amidst the planet's opulence and must outwit the Captain and his robotic parrot, Polyphase Avatron.
The Doctor has discovered the sinister truth about Zanak and solved the mystery of the missing planet. On the Bridge, the Doctor meets the real ruler of Zanak.
Time is running out for the Doctor and Romana in their struggle to defeat the Captain. They join forces with the Mentiads to prevent the Captain and Xanxia from using Zanak to consume Earth.
Investigating a stone circle in England, the Doctor and Romana encounter ancient alien justice and a Celtic goddess.
The third segment's pursuit intertwines with a local myth, leading them to confront living stones and intergalactic justice.
As the blood-hungry Ogri close in, the Doctor launches a desperate attempt to rescue Romana from hyperspace.
The Doctor releases two alien justice machines from imprisonment but they sentence him to death! Meanwhile, Romana searches for clues that will reveal Vivien Fay's true identity.
In a tale reminiscent of "The Prisoner of Zenda," the Doctor and Romana find themselves in a feud over the Taran throne, with the fourth segment key to the conflict.
Romana is kidnapped for her resemblance to a princess, while the Doctor navigates Taran politics and android duplicates.
While Romana makes her escape from the castle, the Doctor is lured to a meeting with an android duplicate of her that is programmed to kill him.
The Doctor attempts to enter to the castle to prevent the marriage of Romana to Prince Reynart and thus thwart Grendel's dastardly plans to rule Tara.
On the marsh moon of Delta Magna, the search for the fifth segment brings the Doctor and Romana into a conflict between colonists and the native Swampies.
The monstrous Kroll, a giant squid worshipped as a god, complicates their mission, holding the key to the segment's location.
With the giant, squid-like monster Kroll awake and angry, the Swampies are eager to appease their 'god' by using the Doctor and Romana as sacrificial victims.

With Kroll on the rampage, the Doctor and Romana are appalled to discover that Thawn intends to fire a rocket at the creature which will also kill the Swampies. Can the Doctor find the fifth segment in time to save the day?
Looking for the final segment of the Key to Time, the Doctor and Romana arrive on the planet Atrios which is in a major nuclear war with the neighbouring world of Zeos.
The Marshal demands that the Doctor devise the ultimate deterrent against the attacking Zeons. But who are the Zeons? The Doctor and Romana begin to suspect that the Marshal is being manipulated.
Journeying to Zeos by transmat, the Doctor finds that it is an empty world. As the Marshal prepares to launch his final attack, the Doctor meets the commander of Zeos's forces.
With the Marshal poised to fire upon Zeos and the Mentalis computer on a countdown to destruction, the Doctor resorts to desperate measures to prevent a cataclysm.
The Doctor and Romana arrive in the lair of the Shadow, servant of the Black Guardian, who also seeks the Key to Time
The tragic truth of the sixth segment of the Key to Time is revealed and if the Black Guardian can control the Key, the whole of time and space will be plunged into eternal chaos.
The Doctor and newly regenerated companion Romana encounter the Daleks on a planet, seeking an ancient weapon.
They discover the Daleks are excavating their creator, Davros, to help them win a war against the Movellans.
Amidst Dalek-Movellan conflict, the Doctor seeks to prevent Davros from granting the Daleks the advantage.
Strategies unfold, leading to a stalemate between the Daleks and Movellans, with Davros taken into custody.
In Paris, the Doctor and Romana stumble upon a time distortion and a plot involving stolen artwork and an alien seeking to repair his ship.
The alien, Scaroth, last of the Jagaroth, intends to fund his time experiments through art theft, altering Earth's history.
Unraveling the mystery, the Doctor and Romana race against time to stop Scaroth from undoing human evolution.
In a climactic confrontation, the Doctor thwarts Scaroth's plan, preserving history and the timeline.
On Chloris, a world rich in plant life but lacking in metal, the Doctor encounters a tyrannical ruler and a creature trapped in a pit.
The creature, an ambassador from another world, has been misunderstood and maligned by the planet's inhabitants.
The Doctor negotiates between the creature and the locals, unveiling mutual benefits and misunderstandings.
Peace is restored, and the Doctor aids the creature in repairing its ship, promoting a newfound understanding.
Investigating a space collision, the Doctor confronts drug smuggling, dimensional instability, and aggressive creatures.
The dimensional accident merges two spaceships, unleashing the deadly Mandrels from Eden.
The Doctor uncovers a narcotics ring using the dimensional technology, working to apprehend the culprits.
Resolving the spatial anomaly, the Doctor disperses the Mandrels back to Eden, ending the drug threat.
The Doctor encounters a civilization in decline, offering youths to the Nimon as tribute, reminiscent of the Minotaur myth.
The Nimon, utilizing the tributes to sustain their energy needs, reveal grander designs for conquest.
As the Nimons' plan for interdimensional expansion becomes clear, the Doctor seeks to thwart their labyrinthine schemes.
The Doctor disables the Nimons' power source, saving the sacrifices and hindering the Nimons' imperial ambitions.
The Doctor visits Cambridge to retrieve a lost book, leading to a discovery of Shada, a Time Lord prison.
They encounter Skagra, who seeks the knowledge of the Time Lords' greatest criminal stored in Shada.
Skagra's plan to create a universal mind threatens, as the Doctor unravels the mysteries of Shada.
In the pursuit of Skagra, the Doctor navigates between Cambridge and the space-time vortex, aiming to protect the imprisoned secrets.
The battle for control of Shada intensifies, revealing the prisoners' potential to alter the universe's balance.
The Doctor outwits Skagra, securing Shada and its prisoners, preserving the fabric of time and space.
The Doctor and Romana visit the Leisure Hive on Argolis, where they become embroiled in a plot involving aging experiments and the planet's turbulent history.
As the Argolins' peace with the Foamasi hangs by a thread, the Doctor uncovers a scheme to weaponize the Hive's technology.
With Romana's help, the Doctor navigates the complex politics of Argolis, thwarting the true culprits behind the sabotage.
The resolution ensures the survival of the Leisure Hive and a new beginning for Argolis, embracing peace and innovation.
On the jungle planet Tigella, the Doctor faces Meglos, the last Zolfa-Thuran, who steals the Dodecahedron, a powerful energy source worshipped by the Tigellans.
Disguised as the Doctor, Meglos infiltrates Tigella, sowing confusion; the Doctor must prove his innocence and recover the Dodecahedron.
The Doctor confronts Meglos, battling through time loops and traps to prevent the use of the Dodecahedron as a weapon.
In a climactic struggle, the Doctor outsmarts Meglos, saving Tigella and ensuring the Dodecahedron's safe return.
Entering the E-Space through a CVE, the Doctor and Romana land on Alzarius, where they encounter the Alzarians and the Marshmen.
Exploring the planet reveals a cycle of evolution and mutation, with the Alzarians and Marshmen connected in unexpected ways.
The Doctor unravels the secrets of Alzarius, aiding the Alzarians in understanding their true nature and origins.
Facing the Marshmen's threat and the planet's mysteries, the Doctor fosters a new understanding between the species, aiding their coexistence.
In another E-Space adventure, the Doctor discovers a planet ruled by Three Who Rule, ancient vampires preying on villagers.
Investigating the vampire legends, the Doctor links the rulers to a larger cosmic threat, the Great Vampires, ancient enemies of the Time Lords.
With Romana and the newly joined companion Adric, the Doctor seeks to ignite a rebellion and find the Great Vampire's resting place.
Utilizing the Tower (the rulers' castle) as a stake, the Doctor defeats the Great Vampire, liberating the planet from its tyrannical rulers.
Trapped in a void at the intersection of E-Space and N-Space, the Doctor encounters the Tharils, enslaved beings who once navigated time.
Exploring the Tharils' history and the nature of the void, the Doctor works to free them, confronting their oppressors, the slavers.
The liberation of the Tharils allows the Doctor to find a way back to N-Space, but at the cost of leaving Romana and K9 in E-Space to aid the Tharils.
The Doctor's actions challenge the concepts of freedom and destiny, marking a poignant farewell to Romana and K9.
Invited to the peaceful Traken Union, the Doctor and Adric face a new threat as an evil presence seeks to corrupt the Source, Traken's power.
The Doctor identifies the malevolence as the Master, seeking a new body and control of the Source to renew his life.
Amidst plots and treachery, the Doctor strives to protect the Keeper and the Source, with the help of Nyssa of Traken.
In a battle for the future of Traken, the Doctor thwarts the Master, but not before he secures a new body, setting the stage for future confrontations.
The Doctor, aware of his own impending doom, goes to Logopolis to repair the TARDIS chameleon circuit, uncovering a universe-threatening entropy crisis.
The Master's interference on Logopolis accelerates the entropy, with the Doctor forging uneasy alliances to counteract the universal decay.
The Doctor's plan to use the CVEs maintained by the Logopolitans spirals into a desperate bid to save the universe from collapsing.
In a tragic sacrifice, the Doctor confronts the Master on the Pharos Project radio telescope, resulting in his fall and regeneration into the Fifth Doctor.
Following his regeneration, the Fifth Doctor, with the help of his companions Adric, Nyssa, and Tegan, seeks refuge in the seemingly idyllic city of Castrovalva.
As the Doctor recovers, they discover that Castrovalva is a fabrication by the Master, designed to trap and disorient the Doctor in a recursive occlusion.
The Doctor and his companions unravel the illusion of Castrovalva, facing the challenge of escaping the Master's complex trap.
With cleverness and resolve, the Doctor overcomes the mental and physical constraints of Castrovalva, thwarting the Master's plan and securing their escape.
The TARDIS lands on a spaceship heading to Earth, controlled by the Urbankans, who plan to colonize the planet by converting humans into androids.
The Doctor discovers the Urbankans' history of absorbing other cultures and their intent to do the same with Earth.
Navigating the ship's dangers and the Urbankans' advanced technology, the Doctor seeks to sabotage their mission.
In a confrontation with the Urbankan leader Monarch, the Doctor uses wit and science to prevent Earth's invasion, ensuring the ship's occupants' freedom.
On the jungle planet Deva Loka, the Doctor encounters the Kinda, a peaceful tribe with a deep connection to the planet's spiritual force.
Tegan falls under the influence of the Mara, an evil entity seeking to escape its dimensional prison through her.
The Doctor unravels the Mara's influence on the Kinda and the impending danger it poses to the universe.
Using the Kinda's understanding of the Mara and a circle of mirrors, the Doctor expels the Mara, restoring peace to Deva Loka.
In 17th-century England, the Doctor and companions stumble upon a plot by the Terileptils to unleash a deadly plague on Earth.
Investigating the Terileptils' crashed ship, the Doctor uncovers their plan to reshape Earth for their own colonization.
The Doctor allies with locals to combat the Terileptils, facing challenges in convincing them of the alien threat.
In a final effort, the Doctor thwarts the Terileptils' scheme, inadvertently starting the Great Fire of London as a means to eradicate the plague.
A historical murder mystery unfolds as the TARDIS crew attends a 1920s costume ball, with Nyssa mistaken for a local aristocrat.
The Doctor solves the mystery, uncovering a tragic tale of family and identity, without the involvement of alien influence, marking a unique story in his adventures.
Responding to a distress signal, the Doctor discovers a plot by the Cybermen to crash a freighter into Earth, causing a prehistoric extinction event.
The Doctor and his companions battle the Cybermen aboard the freighter, struggling to alter its deadly course.
With the freighter locked on a collision path with Earth, the Doctor makes a grim decision to prevent the disaster.
In a devastating sacrifice, Adric stays behind to solve the navigation puzzle, ultimately failing as the freighter crashes, marking a rare companion loss.
Following the emotional events of Earthshock, the Doctor attempts to take his companions back to the 20th century but lands at Heathrow Airport, embroiled in a mystery involving a vanished Concorde.
The Doctor discovers the Master's involvement, using time-displaced Concorde passengers to access an ancient power.
Battling the Master and the elemental forces he seeks to control, the Doctor works to save the passengers and restore normality.
The Doctor outsmarts the Master, saving the day, but the victory is bittersweet as the loss of Adric still weighs heavily on the team.
The Doctor faces a threat from within the Time Lord society as Omega, intent on returning from the anti-matter universe, targets him for a bond that would allow his return to the matter universe.
Omega's attempts to bond with the Doctor lead to dramatic confrontations in Amsterdam, where the Doctor and Nyssa work to save Tegan's cousin.
The Doctor uncovers betrayal within the High Council of Time Lords, fighting to prevent Omega's destructive return to the universe.
In a race against time, the Doctor manages to sever Omega's link to the matter universe, thwarting his plans at the cost of a personal sacrifice.
The Mara returns, manipulating Tegan once more to facilitate its return to the physical realm on the planet Manussa, where it was once worshipped.
As the Doctor unravels the history of the Mara and its connection to Manussan culture, he seeks a way to combat its influence.
The festival celebrating the defeat of the Mara becomes the focal point for its return, with the Doctor battling to prevent it.
Utilizing Manussan history and mythology, the Doctor devises a plan to permanently banish the Mara, saving Tegan and the planet.

The Doctor encounters a time-travel mishap that brings him, Nyssa, and Tegan into contact with Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart, leading to a meeting with the undead Mawdryn and his group, who seek the Doctor's help to die.
Trapped in a time loop and facing the consequences of crossing his own timeline, the Doctor works to understand Mawdryn's condition.
The introduction of Turlough, a student with a secret agenda, complicates the Doctor's efforts to assist Mawdryn and his group without violating the laws of time.
The resolution sees the Doctor navigating the complexities of time, personal sacrifice, and the desire for rest, resolving Mawdryn's plight without regenerating.
The TARDIS crew lands on Terminus, a space station at the center of the universe that has a mysterious link to the creation of the universe and a deadly plague.
Nyssa's confrontation with her own fate, the station's role in spreading a galactic plague, and the possibility of its containment form the crux of the narrative.
The Doctor and his companions wrestle with the moral implications of Terminus's operations and its potential for destruction or salvation.
In a poignant farewell, Nyssa chooses to stay behind to help find a cure for the plague, parting ways with the Doctor and her friends on a note of hope and purpose.
The Doctor, Tegan, and Turlough find themselves aboard an Edwardian racing yacht in space, competing in a race orchestrated by the enigmatic Eternals for the prize of Enlightenment.
As the race unfolds, the true nature of the Eternals and their manipulation of human desires come to light, challenging the Doctor's understanding of the universe.
The Doctor navigates the dangers of the race and the machinations of the Eternals, seeking to secure Enlightenment and prevent it from falling into the wrong hands.
In a battle of wits and wills, the Doctor confronts the Black Guardian, ensuring the safety of his companions and the integrity of the cosmos, with Enlightenment revealed as wisdom, not power.
In medieval England, the Doctor encounters the Master, who is attempting to alter history by inciting civil war through impersonation of King John.
The Doctor exposes the Master's scheme, using his knowledge of history and a quick sleight of hand to restore the timeline and capture the Master.
The Doctor and his past incarnations are taken out of time by a mysterious force, finding themselves in the Death Zone on Gallifrey, facing a series of challenges.
The Doctor, Tegan, and Turlough arrive at an underwater base during a future cold war, finding it under siege by the Silurians and Sea Devils who seek to reclaim Earth.
The base becomes a battleground for survival as the Doctor tries to mediate, facing ethical dilemmas and the threat of global annihilation.
With the Myrka and hostile forces advancing, the Doctor works desperately to prevent the launch of nuclear weapons.
In a tragic conclusion, the Doctor's efforts to bring peace result in a deadly showdown, underscoring the horrors of war and missed opportunities for peace.
In a small English village, the Doctor uncovers a dangerous reenactment of the English Civil War, intensified by an alien influence - the Malus.
The Malus seeks to feed off the psychic energy of the conflict, pushing the village toward real violence; the Doctor intervenes to resolve the historical grievances and neutralize the alien threat.
The TARDIS lands on Frontios, a human colony struggling to survive in the far future, bombarded by meteor showers and mysterious disappearances.
The Doctor discovers the Tractators, insect-like beings manipulating gravity, are behind the colony's plight, dragging people underground.
Confronting the Tractators, the Doctor unearths their plan to use the colonists in their scheme to navigate through space.
Leveraging his knowledge and the colonists' resilience, the Doctor defeats the Tractators, offering the colony a chance to rebuild.
Docked at a 20th-century London warehouse and a space prison, the Doctor faces a Dalek plot to rescue their creator, Davros, and tackle a deadly virus.
With high stakes, the Doctor confronts the Daleks and Davros, facing losses and hard choices, culminating in Tegan's departure, shaken by the violence.
On the volcanic planet Sarn, the Doctor and companions encounter a society worshiping a fire god, with Turlough confronting his past and the Master's machinations.
The Master seeks to harness Sarn's power for regeneration, manipulating its inhabitants and the Doctor's team.
As Turlough's backstory is revealed, the Doctor navigates the complex interplay of faith, science, and identity to thwart the Master.
The Master's defeat and Turlough's departure to return home mark a bittersweet victory, with the introduction of new companion Peri.
The Doctor and Peri land on Androzani Minor, embroiled in a conflict over the valuable substance spectrox, facing corporate greed, mercenaries, and a local rebellion.
Poisoned by spectrox, the Doctor races against time to find an antidote, navigating a complex web of intrigue and betrayal.
The stakes rise as the Doctor's condition worsens, highlighting the harsh realities of Androzani's political and economic battles.
In a heroic finale, the Doctor sacrifices himself to save Peri, leading to his dramatic regeneration into the Sixth Doctor, marking a poignant transition driven by bravery and selflessness.
Following his regeneration, the Sixth Doctor experiences a volatile adjustment period, leading to a rash decision to become a hermit.
The Doctor and Peri get involved with the plight of Romulus and Remus, twin geniuses kidnapped by the slug-like alien, Mestor.
Mestor plans to use the twins' intellect to spread his eggs across the universe, threatening countless lives.
The Doctor confronts his own instability and Mestor's plans, ultimately saving the twins and the universe.
In London and on Telos, the Doctor and Peri encounter the Cybermen plotting to change history by preventing the destruction of their home planet, Mondas.
The Doctor navigates the complexities of Cyberman society and their plans, leading to a confrontation in the Cybermen's tombs.
The TARDIS lands on Varos, a planet where political decisions and punishments are broadcast as entertainment for an oppressed populace.
The Doctor faces moral dilemmas in a society where violence is normalised for entertainment, challenging the governance and offering a new path forward.
In the Industrial Revolution, the Doctor encounters the Rani, a renegade Time Lord, and the Master, both manipulating historical events for their own gain.
The Doctor must thwart both Time Lords' plans, saving the historical timeline and the local population from their experiments.
The Sixth Doctor teams up with the Second Doctor in a time-travel adventure involving the Sontarans and a plan to manipulate time itself.
Encountering old enemies and the ethics of scientific experimentation, the Doctors work together to prevent a cosmic catastrophe.
This multi-Doctor story explores themes of identity and morality, culminating in a victory that respects time's integrity.
On the planet Karfel, the Doctor discovers a society under the thumb of a dictator, where dissent is punished by banishment into the Timelash.
The Doctor's intervention unveils hidden histories and alliances, leading to liberation from tyranny and a reconsideration of heroism and legend.
At a galactic funeral home, the Doctor uncovers a Dalek plot involving the manipulation of the dead, spearheaded by Davros under a new guise.
Facing ethical quandaries and the horror of Davros's scheme, the Doctor acts to thwart the Daleks' plans, ensuring the safety of the galaxy.
The Doctor and Peri discover a divided society on Ravalox, with surface dwellers and an underground technocracy facing an impending catastrophe.
They delve into the mysteries of Ravalox, uncovering secrets that challenge the Time Lords' principles and the very fabric of Time Lord society.
The intrigue deepens with revelations about the stolen secrets of the Time Lords, implicating them in the planet's tragic fate.
The segment concludes with the Doctor questioning the morality of the Time Lords' actions and the nature of his own interventions.
On Thoros Beta, the Doctor and Peri become embroiled in a plot involving the grotesque Mentor, Sil, and the ambitious scientist Kiv.
As the situation escalates, the Doctor appears to betray Peri, leading to dramatic consequences under the Valeyard's manipulative narrative.
The tension peaks with Peri's apparent demise and the Doctor's ethical boundaries being pushed to their limits.
The segment ends with shocking twists and the Doctor's actions under severe scrutiny, casting doubt on his character.
Aboard the Hyperion III, the Doctor and Mel face the Vervoids, plant beings intending to eradicate all non-plant life.
The mystery of the Vervoids' origin and their deadly purpose unfolds, challenging the Doctor and Mel to find a solution.
The Doctor takes drastic measures to stop the Vervoids, leading to ethical debates about genocide and the right to intervene.
The Doctor's defense concludes with reflections on justice and morality, further complicating the trial's proceedings.
The Doctor faces off against the Valeyard in a battle that goes beyond the courtroom, delving into the Matrix for a final confrontation.
Revelations about the Valeyard's identity and the Doctor's resolve bring the trial to a climactic end, with questions about his future and the nature of Time Lord justice lingering.
The newly regenerated Seventh Doctor is manipulated by the Rani, a renegade Time Lord, who seeks his expertise for her experiment to control evolution across the cosmos.
The Doctor, grappling with his new identity, must outwit the Rani and free the kidnapped geniuses she's using to fuel her scheme.
With the help of Mel, his companion, the Doctor navigates the Rani's traps and the hostile environment of Lakertya.
The Doctor thwarts the Rani's plans, saving the universe from her tampering and setting the tone for his unpredictable and crafty incarnation.
The Doctor and Mel visit Paradise Towers, a utopian high-rise that has degraded into a dystopian nightmare, ruled by gangs and robotic cleaners.
They uncover the dark secret behind the building's decline and the true horror controlling the cleaners.
The Doctor allies with the tower's disparate groups to confront the building's architect and the lurking menace.
Through ingenuity, the Doctor revitalizes the spirit of cooperation among the residents, defeating the malevolent force and rejuvenating Paradise Towers.
The Doctor and Mel win a trip on a 1950s bus tour to Disneyland that takes a detour to Wales, entangling them in an interstellar conflict involving the Chimeron queen, Delta.
As Delta is pursued by the genocidal Bannermen, the Doctor works to protect her and her species' future.
The tale combines comedy with tragedy, featuring memorable music and a showdown that ensures the safety of Delta and her child.
On the ice planet Svartos, the Doctor and Mel encounter Sabalom Glitz and a young waitress, Ace, who becomes a key figure in the Doctor's life.
They explore the mystery of the Dragon and its guard over a supposedly vast treasure, facing the villainous Kane.
The Doctor navigates the complexities of greed, friendship, and loyalty, ultimately defeating Kane and welcoming Ace as a new companion.
Set in 1963 London, the Doctor and Ace are embroiled in a Dalek civil war, with factions seeking the Hand of Omega, a Time Lord artifact the Doctor left on Earth.
The battle intensifies, revealing the Daleks' plan to use the Hand of Omega to manipulate time. The Doctor's strategic mind is put to the test against his oldest enemies.
The Doctor confronts the Dalek Emperor, leading to hard choices and the destruction of Skaro's sun, showcasing the Doctor's darker, manipulative side.
The resolution reshapes the balance of power in the universe and reinforces the Doctor's commitment to guarding Earth.
On the planet Terra Alpha, happiness is enforced by law, and the Doctor and Ace challenge the tyrannical regime of Helen A and her enforcers, the Happiness Patrol.
They inspire rebellion among the downtrodden citizens and confront the monstrous Kandyman, a reflection of the absurdity and horror of enforced happiness.
The Doctor's actions lead to the regime's downfall, exploring themes of freedom, oppression, and the pursuit of genuine happiness.
The Doctor and Ace encounter a 25th-century Neo-Nazi group, a South American werewolf, and Cybermen, all converging in 1988 to claim the Nemesis statue, made of validium.
The statue, sent into orbit by the Doctor centuries earlier, becomes the focal point of a complex plot involving time travel and betrayal.
With clever maneuvering, the Doctor ensures the Nemesis targets the Cybermen's fleet, highlighting his chessmaster approach to conflict.

As UNIT are transporting a nuclear warhead around Carbury, knights in armour arrive to continue waging a war that began thousands of years ago, but in a wholly different dimension.
The Doctor and Ace explore King Arthur's spaceship deep under Lake Vortigern, while Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart arrives in Carbury where he encounters Morgaine.
Furious at her inability to find and engage Arthur in battle, Morgaine threatens to unleash the Destroyer upon the planet unless the Doctor gives her what she wants.
The Brigadier slays the Destroyer while Morgaine takes control of UNIT's nuclear warhead and prepares to start a countdown that will destroy Earth forever.
The Doctor and Ace explore Victorian house Gabriel Chase and realise it hides just as many dark secrets in its drawing room as it does in its dark cellar.
The Doctor and Scotland Yard's finest, Inspector Mackenzie, attempt to question Josiah Smith while both Light and Control emerge from their respective slumbers.
Only Redvers, still searching for the elusive Saxe-Coburg, seems able to withstand Light and communicate with Control. Ace realises her past actions need to be dealt with.
As Russian forces approach the English coastline, an ancient evil stirs beneath the surface of the water. For Ace and the Doctor, a deadly game of revenge has begun.
The Viking runes in the crypt contain a secret to Ace's past. Meanwhile, Millington and Judson's Ultima machine offer to break the chains of the Wolves of Fenric.
The Haemovores attack St Jude's church.
The Ancient Haemovore stands upon Earth once again, determined to change the future by erasing the past. Ace finally feels love for her mother.
rying to work out why people have been disappearing from Perivale, Ace is cornered by Kara, a Cheetah-Person who transports her to a far-off planet..
The Doctor and a number of people from Perivale follow Ace to the Cheetah-People's world, where the Master lies in wait. He cannot leave without the Doctor's assistance.
As the alien world dies around them, the Doctor and the Master fight like animals before escaping to Earth, where their war ends. And somewhere else, the tea is getting cold.
